alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Coastal Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 12:08PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...ELEVATED RISK FOR FIRE SPREAD TODAY DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS... As of Noon, a Red Flag Warning has been issued for these areas and therefore this Special Weather Statement is replaced by the warning. A combination of low relative humidity, breezy west winds, and dry fine fuels will lead to an elevated risk for fire spread with any potential fire ignitions today across portions of southern New Jersey. Minimum relative humidity values this afternoon will range from 25 to 30 percent across the area. West winds will increase to around 15 to 20 mph with frequent gusts ranging from 25 to 35 mph. Fine fuels in the form of dry or dead vegetation will be quite dry as well, and conducive to fire ignition and rapid fire spread. Residents are urged to exercise caution if handling any potential ignition source, including machinery, cigarettes, and matches. Be sure to properly discard all smoking materials. Any dry grasses, dead leaves, and other tree litter that ignite will have the potential to spread fire quickly. For more information about wildfire danger, burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and eduction, please visit your state`s forestry or environmental protection website.
